Topic.Title: MR. YAHOO - Please clean up the Yahoo Messageboards

Message.Msg: Post one of your so called letters that you wrote to all these companies I would like to see this master piece. Hopefully you used capital letters at the beginning of your sentences, maybe even some punctuation unlike the non-sense that you write on these boards. You claim to have the intrest of others in mind but since you have already disclosed that you are "shorting this down to a buck...chuck" that just shows everyone that your only here for personal gain and everything you say is disregaurded immediately. Since I have a real regaurd in the best intrest of all people and not just myself, may I suggest covering your short position before the numbers come out here soon, or maybe before the muti-billion $ IPO of Alibaba. Kids don't read Y! message boards and the rest of us are grown ups that know how to use the ignore button. Best of luck!

Topic.Title: MR. YAHOO - Please clean up the Yahoo Messageboards

Message.Msg: yes, the letter i sent to both the New York Times and E-Trade can be seen under the title"'letter sent to Gen. Mgr. of The NYT" I sent that letter to NYT and Etrade... 1) no, in messageboard writings i don't normally use punctualtion formalities, but do in letters as i wrote to NYT and Etrade 2) the thing about "shorting" this stock to a buck was just for show to get some attention from what seemed, until your sensible normal response, a bunch of people who liked having all the stuff i am complaining about on the messageboards and were taunting me....so i did that solely for attention, and to illustrate that if yahoo's reputation were damaged seriously enough because of my claims, shorting yahoo would be an economically rational thing to do...nonetheless, i am disgusted thoroughly that yahoo doesn't take a stronger stand against the @#$%^ that is on the boards...(i typed the @#$%^ myself, it wasn't done by yahoo)...i have seen postings of rape, and nothing is done by yahoo, postings of animal sex and nothing is done, postings of incest and nothing is done, despite my, and others, making abuse reports on yahoo's system of reporting abusive posts...that is the real issue....you think you can come and talk all nice and reasnable to distract the real issue...why don't you talk about the disugust-ridden messages that are posted everyday here (not just on YHOO), ALSO, i have had a poster use my alias and know of another on the FMCC board who has had the same thing happen...our conclusion is that someone in the yahoo abuse "department" is doing it...because we've made reports on that impersonation and nothing is done there as well....you're trying to deflect the real issue

Topic.Title: MR. YAHOO - Please clean up the Yahoo Messageboards

Message.Msg: what i'm getting at is this: if the whole "world" knew yahoo was tolerating, perhaps to the point of encouraging, postings, like i said of rape, incest and animal sex, by not enforcing THEIR OWN ABUSE POLICIES, and if it got enough attention (like in the press), then, sure SHORT THIS STOCK because yahoo would lose face (unless they somehow coould explain to the public how allowing such posts happened in the first place and could successfully show that they bore no blame)...and the thing about kids never watching these board is also a deflection because they could if they wanted to, the messageboards are not "off-limits" to them...and therefore, to be fair, the fact that they "don't" frequent the boards isn't really relevant

Message.Title: Yahoo + Alibaba math question.
Message.Msg: Yahoo owns 24% of Alibaba, so if Alibaba goes public and issues shares of stock, Yahoo would own 24% of the shares. Do the shares get deposited into the Yahoo treasury or will the Yahoo shareholders get the Alibaba stock? And If the IPO is worth 100 billion, Yahoo split is 24 billion, divided by 1 billion outstanding shares, that's $24.00 per share. Is this correct?

Topic.Title: MR. YAHOO - Please clean up the Yahoo Messageboards

Message.Msg: it is time to take your medication.. you are crazy...

Topic.Title: Yahoo + Alibaba math question.

Message.Msg: Hmmm the "shares" are irrelevant as Yahoo owns 24% of the whole thing regardless of the number. To answer your question Yahoo already has the shares as they've owned it since 05', its in either the August or October SEC filing that you can get off of the Yahoo Investor Relations site. I think its only a few million shares but don't hold me to that. If it does IPO at $100B then Yahoo is obligated to sell half which is $12B and to pay taxes knocks it down to $8B range. Your assumptions are pretty much correct in that on paper Yahoo has AG//Yahoo Japan/cash that exceeds current valuation which means you could give the core a value of zero and still be ahead.

Topic.Title: Yahoo + Alibaba math question.

Message.Msg: WOW, in just about one year the IPO has gone from $40 billion to $100 billion with nothing but –I think it´s going to be more than the last Yahoo long estimated- to base it on. And we are already seeing a few posters pumping $120 billion. I guess we will see $200 billion before long. It does bring to mind the time AliPay was supposed to be worth over $25 billion and was then sold at $50 million.

Topic.Title: MR. YAHOO - Please clean up the Yahoo Messageboards

Message.Msg: Most of the posters on these boards are either institutional traders, retail traders or paid 'PR" shills from India or elsewhere. These shills are paid by Wall Street vermin to bash or pump a stock. Sometimes they do both. Many of these posters of are fold mouthed, SFB, greedy, AHOLES.However, if YHOO would take action to clean up their boards, the number of posts would crater lowering the amount they get from advertising fees. Recent polls by YHOO found a high level of dissatisfaction by the people who use these message boards. Too bad YHOO's ad clients didn't read the results. Certain groups now appear to be putting pressure on YHOO to censor posts making racial or anti-gay slurs. FYI, it's a simple thing for YHOO to remove these posts or censor the poster, but Mayer appears either too arrogant or too busy reading her press clippings to take any action. Instead of being a vehicle to discuss investing, 90% of the posts are either about politics, short traders trying to instill fear in retail investors, long traders pumping the stock, or just psychopaths acting out.

Message.Title: Alibaba's Asset Securitization Product Approved
Message.Msg: (Beijing) – A new asset-backed securitization plan jointly developed by Alibaba's financial arm and brokerage firm Orient Securities Asset Management Co. has won approval from the securities regulator and is expected to be offered to investors soon. A source close to the matter said on July 4 that the plan, which is operated by Orient Securities, will allow people to invest in loans that Alibaba has provided to small businesses on the Internet giant's online platform.

Message.Title: Yahoo: Momentum Could Send The Stock To $27
Message.Msg: Yahoo Inc., still has a very attractive P/E ratio of 7.5, no debt on its books and a profit margin of 65.66% in 2012. Although, Yahoo does not pay any dividends, the stock is trading very close to its 52-week high of $27.68 per share. The three year EPS growth rate is a robust 44.83% while the recent quarterly change is an impressive 52.17%. Technically speaking, Yahoo looks good and the stock is likely to test the 50-day moving average [MA] of 25.87. A break of this level would see a test of the mid-May highs near 28, which is above the 14.59-27.68 52-week range.
